author: JIM NELSON for the Daily Telegraph
title: Beavers return, demolish Red Devils
text:
Chris Jackson/The Register-Herald Routing the Red Devils... 
Bluefield's Josh Fowler (33) carries the ball on a kickoff return as teammate Ashton Shaw (34) watches during their football game Friday night in Oak Hill. Posted: Saturday, October 24, 2015 1:16 am Beavers return, demolish Red Devils By JIM NELSON for the Daily Telegraph bdtonline.com 
OAK HILL — Ten possessions, 10 touchdowns. in their return from a two-week idle period, Bluefield dominated Oak Hill on Friday night, beating the Red Devils 70-0 at John P. Duda Field. 
Bluefield forced a fumble on Oak Hill’s first snap, recovered by Jamere Edwards. One play later, Jason Edwards thundered in for Bluefield’s first touchdown. 
Mookie Collier tacked on three first-quarter touchdowns on successive scoring runs of 5, 72 and 48 yards. 
In the second period, Jordan Smith found Carlos Reed on a short swing pass and Reed sped past the Oak Hill defense for a 52-yard score. 
Collier’s fourth touchdown of the half, a 58-yard lightning bolt, put Bluefield up 42-0. Later in the quarter, Jason Edwards added his second scoring run, this one from nine yards out, and Bluefield led 49-0 at the break. 
Bluefield’s second unit took over after halftime and scored three touchdowns in a five-snap sequence. Jamere Edwards had two of those TDs, with runs of 40 and 29, sandwiched around an Arnold Martin 43-yard score. 
With the win, Bluefield goes to 6-1 heading into next Friday’s showdown with James Monroe at Mitchell Staidum. 
At John P. Duda Field 
Bluefield 28 21 21 0 — 70 
Oak Hill 0 0 0 0 — 0

B - Jason Edwards 10 run (Zac Springman kick), 11:44 
B - Mookie Collier 5 run (Springman kick), 6:59 
B - Collier 72 run (Springman kick), 5:17
